info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN ROOSEVELT...NORTHEASTERN CHAVES AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 644 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Tolar to 10 miles south of Kenna. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Melrose, Elida, Saint Vrain, Kenna, and Floyd. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 348 and 375. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
